metadata.title: CVE-2024-52006 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Git may pass on Carriage Returns via the credential protocol tocredential helpers which use line-reading functions thatinterpret said Carriage Returns as line endings, even though Gitdid not intend that.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-52006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-all - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-cvs - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-daemon-run - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-email - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-gui - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-man - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-mediawiki - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-svn - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
gitk - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
gitweb - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12').
